children.text: There are gaps in the external walls where embers may enter in the event of a bushfire.
relevant Australian Standard AS 3959 Construction of Buildings in Bushfire-Prone Areas states that
‘All joints in the external surface material of walls shall be covered, sealed, overlapped, backed or butt-jointed to prevent gaps greater than 3 mm’ .
The builder must make these areas comply with the BAL requirements for occupant safety reasons.
